intro: Cynoglossum haenkei, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along streambanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Cynoglossum haenkei is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
